sections.summary: The text identifies the Quran as a clarifying **Book** and notes that disbelievers will eventually long to have been Muslims. It addresses the historical pattern of communities ridiculing messengers and explains that even physical access to the heavens would not compel faith in those whose vision is bewitched by **transgression**.

Allah highlights His power through the creation of **constellations** and the protection of the heavens from every outcast devil. Terrestrial signs, including the spreading of the earth, the placement of **stabilizers** (mountains), and the cycle of life facilitated by **fertilizing winds**, are presented as evidence of His role as the sole Life-giver and provider of **sustenance**.

This section details the creation of humanity from **molded mud** and jinn from **piercing fire**, followed by the command for the angels to prostrate to Adam. It recounts **Satan's** refusal due to pride, his subsequent status as an **outcast**, and his vow to glamorize evil on earth for everyone except Allah's **sincere servants**.

The **righteous** are promised an eternal residence in **Gardens** with flowing springs, which they enter in peace and security. Allah emphasizes the removal of all **ill-feelings** from their hearts, granting them a state of brotherhood where no fatigue will ever touch them.

Messengers in the form of guests visit **Abraham** to announce the birth of a knowledgeable son before proceeding to the town of Lot. The narrative details the rescue of Lot’s family and the destruction of the **sinful people** by a morning **Blast** and the city being **turned upside down** for their practice of **lewdness**.

The communities of the **Woods** and the **Rock (Al-Hijr)** are cited as wrongdoers who rejected divine messengers and signs. Despite carving secure **homes in the mountains**, their acquisitions did not protect them from the morning **Blast** that left them annihilated.

Allah affirms the creation of the heavens and earth with **truth** and highlights the gift of the **seven of the pairs** and the **Grand Quran**. The surah concludes with instructions to ignore the **mockers**, celebrate the praises of the Lord, and maintain **worship** until the attainment of certainty.
